p: Research also revealed that lupeol has an anti-aging effect on UVA aged fibroblasts [ 44]. It is well-known that repeated UVA skin damage can produce DNA alteration, ROS generation and could also affect MMPs expression. The study revealed that lupeol treatment on UVA radiated dermal fibroblast inhibited p16, p21 and p-p53 and decreased the MMP-1, -2, -3 expression.
